column4: I am having problems with the Startup-Manager app if someone has time to help me with it

fair enough. when I try to add a new usplash in startup-manager, it just closes. no error, no prompt to point to the new usplash I want to import. I tried uninstalling it and reinstalling it but it doesnt change
Already tried with sudo aptitude remove --purge package && sudo aptitude install package     ?
I did ask you recommended, but I get the same issue. when I try to run startupmanager from terminal, I get a "segmentation fault" before the app crashes
seg fault ??? weird... maybe you can search in launchpad for a bug related to it.... because seg fault is something, err... a bug in system or in the app
thats where I looked before I hopped in here. I have found errors of it not running at all, but nothing about it crashing with trying to add an .so file
Ok, srry, i was breakfasting :). Last one seems like your problem ...
really? let me check it again.
could you give me a bug number, I am not seeing it
Yeah, but the answers doesn't solve anything :(
ahh, I did read that one. I cant find any other material about it. It launches fine, it just crashes when I try to install anything....the Add button = the crash button
I might just have to ride it out then
yeah... i was just going to say say same --purge thing :(
oh well. Ill see if there are any fixes later down the line...thanks for your assistance anyway :-D
